<p> In Indonesia, (especially Yogyakarta) there are male, female, and mixed HMO. From the graph above, it can be seen that on average, <b>mixed gender HMO is more expensive than the single gender counterpart </b>. Other than that, prices of mixed HMOs are spread out more than males or females HMO. This is caused by the nature of mixed gender HMOs in Indonesia where <b> someone can live with their partner, which is controversial in Indonesia</b>. Mixed gender HMOs are taboo and usually called <i>'Kos Las Vegas'</i> because of its nature. This create a premium for someone who wants to live with their partner</p>
